name: Dar es Salaam
fun_fact: Fun fact: Dar es Salaam is credited as the birthplace of Chipsi Mayai - an egg and French fry omelette that became Tanzania's beloved street food, invented when creative vendors combined leftover fries with eggs!

hero_dishes.name: Chipsi Mayai
hero_dishes.description: Egg and French fry omelette - the city's signature street food invention
hero_dishes.origin_story: Born in Dar es Salaam when street vendors combined leftover fries with eggs
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street stalls throughout the city, best with kachumbari salad

hero_dishes.name: Mishkaki
hero_dishes.description: BBQ-flavored meat skewers with Zanzibar-style spices
hero_dishes.origin_story: Dar es Salaam is credited as the home of these mouthwatering skewers
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Mamboz Corner BBQ, street-side stands at evening markets

hero_dishes.name: Zanzibar Mix (Urojo)
hero_dishes.description: Deep-fried cassava, plantains, chapati, and marinated meat in tangy soup
hero_dishes.origin_story: Swahili Coast fusion of Arab, Indian, and African flavors
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Bustling local markets and roadside food stalls

hero_dishes.name: Vitumbua
hero_dishes.description: Rice and coconut milk pancake-doughnuts with cardamom
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street food stalls along the seaside

signature_drinks.name: Coconut water
signature_drinks.description: Fresh from the shell, sold by street vendors
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Straight from machete-cut coconuts at beach stalls

signature_drinks.name: Tangawizi
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Refreshing cold drink at local markets

food_culture_notes: Mamboz Corner BBQ takes over pavements at night with firigisi (gizzards) and maini (livers)
Hotelis (local cafÃ©s) serve chakula for under $5
Ugali (ground corn) served with meat or fish stews
Kachumbari (tomato, onion, cucumber salad) accompanies everything

unique_modern: mix of colonial and modern architecture
